title: U.S. Millennials : most popular social network 2016 , by age group
summary: This grouped bar chart represents 7 different Platforms on X-axis for 3 groups 18-24, 25-29, and 30-34. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of respondents.
Platform Facebook had the maximum Share of respondents among all 3 groups, and it was for 30-34. The minimum Share of respondents was observed in Platform Twitter for 25-29.
Platform Facebook and Twitter had the biggest gap of 40.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondents found for 25-29.
On average, the Platform Facebook had the highest Share of respondents for all 3 groups 18-24, 25-29, and 30-34. Whereas Twitter had the lowest average Share of respondents.

Platform Facebook had the maximum Share of respondents among all 3 groups, and it was for 30-34. The minimum Share of respondents was observed in Platform Twitter for 25-29.

max_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 7 different Platforms on X-axis for 3 groups 18-24, 25-29, and 30-34. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of respondents.
For Platform Facebook, 30-34 had the highest Share of respondents 50.0 among the 3 groups and in Twitter, 25-29 had the lowest Share of respondents 1.0.
Among all the Platforms, 25-29 had the highest Share of respondents in Platform Facebook and lowest Share of respondents in Platform Twitter.
There is a gap of 40.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondents found for 25-29 in Platform Facebook and Twitter.
Among all 3 groups, 25-29 had the gap of 40.0 between the maximum and minimum Share of respondents observed in Platform Facebook and Twitter respectively.

In case of Platform Facebook, 30-34 had the highest Share of respondents 50.0 among the 3 groups and in Twitter, 25-29 had the lowest Share of respondents 1.0. The second highest Share of respondents 41.0 was observed for 30-34 in Platform Facebook.
On average, the Platform Facebook had the highest Share of respondents for all 3 groups 18-24, 25-29, and 30-34. Whereas Twitter had the lowest average Share of respondents.
